intro: Parahebe laxa, commonly known as the slender parahebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Parahebe laxa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
